Merge two processed NULISAseq data objects

mergeProcessedNULISAseq.Rd

This function merges two NULISAseq data objects that have already been processed (e.g., by mergeNULISAseq), combining their metadata, sample, target, QC, and data matrices into a single unified object for downstream analysis. It handles duplicate plate IDs, file names, and sample names, and ensures compatibility of assay types and AQ units.

Usage

mergeProcessedNULISAseq(existing_data, new_data)

Arguments

existing_data

A processed NULISAseq data object (as returned by mergeNULISAseq) representing the existing dataset.

new_data

A processed NULISAseq data object (as returned by mergeNULISAseq) representing the new dataset to be merged.

Value

A named list containing:

plateID

Character vector of plate IDs

fileNames

Character vector of file names

ExecutionDetails

List of execution details for each plate

RunSummary

Data frame summarizing each run

IC

Character, the internal control used

targets

Data frame of target information

samples

Data frame of sample information

qcSample

Data frame of sample-level QC metrics

qcTarget

Data frame of target-level QC metrics (if present)

qcPlate

Data frame of plate-level QC metrics

aqParams

Data frame of AQ target parameters (if present)

excluded

Vector of excluded targets (if any)

Data_IC, Data_IClog2, Data_raw, Data_rawlog2, aboveLOD, Data_AQ, Data_AQlog2, Data_Reverse, Data_Reverselog2, Data_AQ_pgmL, Data_AQlog2_pgmL

Matrices of merged data (if present)

unit

Character, AQ unit (if present)

Details

- Checks for duplicate plate IDs, file names, and sample names, and renames as needed. - Ensures consistent internal control (IC) and AQ units across datasets. - Combines all available data matrices, keeping only common targets. - Handles missing or NULL QC and AQ parameter data frames gracefully.

Examples

# merged <- mergeProcessedNULISAseq(existing_data, new_data)
